results.title: The Islands of Torres Strait
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Torres Strait is a treacherous waterway between Cape York, the northern most tip of the Australian mainland and Papua New Guinea. The shallow strait is dotted with Islands and coral outcrops. From Possession Island at the southern extremity, Captain James Cook formally laid claim to the Australian colonies in the name of England. Later the Queensland Government moved to control the Islands of the Strait and their people. Once, the islanders currency of trade was human heads, and headhunting raids between the islands and mainland Papua New Guinea was part of life. On this journey through the islands, Ted Egan meets some old friends, sees dugout canoes being built and meets the keeper of the legendary Drums of Mer.

results.title: The Islanders
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Aspects of life in the Torres Strait Islands, showing the rich culture of the people with their songs and dances, set against bright tropical backgrounds, in striking contrast to many parts of Australia. Shows how strongly the old traditions still affect the people, even though they have modern schools, shops, out-board motors and transistors.

results.title: The Island of Dr Moreau
results.creator_credit: Edward Pressman, New Line Cinema and John Frankenheimer
results.brief_description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind.

constellations_other.name: Doctors of Evil
constellations_other.description: Villains get all the best lines and if they're mad scientists, they get all the best toys too. Evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is one member of long lineage of science supervillains.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Pressman, New Line Cinema and John Frankenheimer
results.description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind. Adapted from the H.G. Wells story. Cast includes Val Kilmer, Marlon Brando, David Thewlis, Fairuza Balk, Ron Perlman, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: The Isa
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: A documentary about Mt Isa produced in 1969. The Isa, 30 minutes. Produced for the Mt. Isa Mines Ltd. Mt. Isa mine and city as seen by business men, tourists and residents enjoying life in this new and ever developing mining city in Northern Queensland.

results.title: The Irish in Australia: Echo of a Distant Drum
results.creator_credit: Orana Films, Michael Balson, Matthew Flanagan and Richard Dennison
results.brief_description: One in three Australians have Irish origins - and this is reflected in the national character. The humour; the sense of self-mockery; ideals of fair play; the dislike of pomp and bombast; the celebration of noble failure; are all characteristics both Irish and Australian. The story of the Irish in Australia has been one of conflict, often echoing dramatic events in Ireland. It’s a history that has been potentially so divisive that it has been ignored. But it is the key to understanding why Australia has become the democratic nation that it is, and yet remains ambivalent on national issues.

results.title: The Irish empire
results.creator_credit: Ritchie Cogan, Hilton Cordell Productions, Little Bird (Dublin), Cafe Productions (London), Alan Gilsenan, David Roberts and Dearbhla Walsh
results.brief_description: Ireland is just a tiny country that has never sought domination, yet it has established Irishness and Irish power bases and communities from Chicago to Vladivistok, from Australia to Argentina. There is no physical empire, but an empire of imagination, a virtual empire, whose followers outnumber the native population in Ireland by over fifteen to one. From a home population of just 4 million, some 70 million people around the world call themselves Irish, or claim Irish descent. This is a thought-provoking exploration of how the Irish have so often triumphed over adversity and established themselves all over the world. It explores the past and present attitudes and ideas which have allowed the Irish people to spread across the world without loosing a sense of identity generations later. Narrated by Fiona Shaw.

results.title: The IQ myth. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: An examination of the ways the IQ concept has been used and misused. It focuses on the question of how much importance should be placed on the test result. This can mean the difference between success or failure in school and adult life, and such exams have been used to categorise entire cultures and races as mentally inferior

results.title: The Inward eye
results.brief_description: It is difficult for the outsider to understand the astonishing solutions to life that the handicapped can find. Gordon Stent went blind in 1962. He was running his own business, but was forced to give it up. He retired to Bournemouth where he set out to make a new life. There was one thing he wanted to do - he wanted to become an artist - the first blind artist in the world.

results.title: The Invisible World
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Alex Pomasanoff
results.brief_description: If it were not for some extraordinary photographic techniques, sophisticated cameras and imaging devices, many events that the human eye cannot perceive - because these occurrences are too small, too large, too fast or beyond the spectrum of visible light - would go unnoticed. This film captures such events that would otherwise escape our inspection.
